alert.note: Alert for Livingston; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 12:45AM EDT until June 16 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN WYOMING AND CENTRAL LIVINGSTON COUNTIES... At 1245 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Perry, or near Letchworth State Park, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Geneseo, Letchworth State Park, Perry, Warsaw, Mount Morris, Conesus, Groveland, Livonia, Covington and Castile. This includes Interstate 390 between exits 5 and 8. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
